nodes.text: Assistant Auditor-General was a title given to a high ranking official in the Corporate Sector Authority who worked as one the assistants to the Auditor-General. Their primary responsibilities were confirm information that was sent to the Auditor-General's office and investigate suspicious activity. This office also oversees the security division of the CSA. Hart-and-Parn Gorra-Fiolla was given this title only three years after joining the law enforcement arm of the CSA.
